question_text: A technician connects a TRRS headset to a device, but the microphone is not working while audio playback functions normally. What is the most likely cause?
answer_options: The device only has a TRS (3-conductor) audio jack
correct_answer: The device only has a TRS (3-conductor) audio jack
explanation: If audio works but the microphone doesn't, the device likely has a TRS (Tip Ring Sleeve) jack instead of TRRS, meaning it only supports audio output, not microphone input.
